channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Council continue to ignore there is ongoing problem with dumped bags, furniture.....on Walworth road, Camberwell road and more streets, 1st October
item.description:
YOU NEED TO COLLECTING BINS BAGS, BINS, SWIPE STREETS MORE FREQUENTLY, BEST IS CLEANING OVER NIGTS , LIKE ANOTHERS COUNTRIES This area is Very busy, comulation lots of people and you must work adequate to situation. Where are a big water cleaning cars for a streets ? No one seem them!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 181,183, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and cannisters dumped by cycle storage outside flat 9, 72 Grove Lane, 1st October
item.description:
Mattress reported dumped by cycle storage outside flat 9, 72 Grove Lane. Reported previously and reply said it had been dealt with but it is still there. Now some kind of cannister have been added to it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Cutcombe Road, Loughborough Junction, London

item.title: Twenty bags of garden waste dumped on pavement, 1st October
item.description:
Just yards from the entrance to our local school, fly tippers have dumped about twenty bags of garden waste and other material on the pavement in Kemsing Road, Greenwich SE10 0LL near the junction with Ormiston Road. The rubbish is a hazard to children and pedestrians using the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Kemsing Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow box paint faded, 1st October
item.description:
As you exit the Brixton Curry’s on Edgar Road, there is a small yellow junction box. The yellow paint is very faded and can be a bit difficult to see. Please repaint this!

item.title: This sign and bay are misleading and misrepresentative to residents leading to the issuance of PCN’s, 1st October
item.description:
This bay has NO ACTIVE CHARGING POINT that would allow it to act as a proper EV space. As such it is confusing to those of us who are B permit holders and EV car owners and has lead to numerous PCN’s for using the space without an active charge. Either the sign should be removed or a working charging point should be installed. As it stands it can’t be used as a charging spot or a parking space which penalises us as residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Talbot Road, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van appears to be abandoned too close to junction, 1st October
item.description:
This van was parked up about a month ago and we have not seen anyone else go to it and it hasn't been moved at all. Due to the close proximity to the school and where it is parked right at the end of the junction we are concerned about childrens safety being dropped off and collected from school and would be grateful if you could check the status on this vehicle please. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fair Acres, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Miss use of highway, 1st October
item.description:
3 bins have been out for several months 2 additional bins added on Sunday and still there parking is at a premium and a number of visually impaired people negotiate the obstructions

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 206, Widmore Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scaffolding on both sides, 1st October
item.description:
There is scaffolding on both sides of Vigo street at the moment which is extremely DANGEROUS as the middle road is a cycle lane! People cycle really fast here and its extremely unsafe for the public. At many instances have people been run over (an old guy fell over and started bleeding the other day) and since there is a lot of foot traffic there you should make it a pedestrian street only for safety until the works are done. The bikers are not careful at all, I live around the corner and I have a toddler. Its extremely unsafe. Do something about it until the works are done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Vigo Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet
